website_summaries.verdict: Heavier than expected for an electric jackhammer, but still manageable. Affordable price point makes it worth owning instead or renting other models for demo work.
pros: Included bits tear through material like higher end machines
Customers report years of reliable service
Only requires a heavy duty extension cord and 110v current
cons: Case and safety gear not high quality
Oil levels must be checked regularly, some leakage reported
Bits are nonstandard sizes, difficult to replace

customer_reviews.title: Bust things up.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sure worked for me. Went thru 5" concrete easily, and because it's smaller than the type you stand over - the kind with 2 handles - it was more manuverable in the tight space bathroom I was in. I am very happy with this tool after about 3-4 hrs usage. Hope it lasts. Btw, the case is kinda cheap but I have no plans on using its wheels, which look like they'll fall to pieces after only a few feet of rolling. I just carry the whole thing and for that, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchtown

customer_reviews.title: Great for Breaking Up Concrete Driveways
customer_reviews.text: My driveway is being invaded by pine roots, so I decided to buy the tools and replace sections as needed. This jackhammer made short work of breaking up 4" concrete and even worked well for cutting through roots (purchased a wider blade, 3" scraping chisel for root cutting). I also used the 3" scraping chisel to cut through compacted clay and roots; so I could plant azaleas. So far absolutely no complaints. The tool is heavy enough to cut through stubborn materials but no so heavy as to be difficult to maneuver. It appears to be well made and, for my occasional use, will probably last me a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: KevinGa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent demolition hammer. Should have gotten this a long time ago. Does in a few minutes what my Bosch Bulldog takes hours (the Bulldog is great for tile, but cement slabs are another story). The weight is what's important here, the various wattages are just a distraction. Comes with everything except oil (understandable - as they don't want that leaking during shipping; I used bar-and-chain oil, which seems to work just fine). You can see why it doesn't take SDS bits - they're puny compared to the bits this things takes (which are included anyway). Vibration seemed fine. Certainly no worse than the air-powered jack hammers I've used. And easier to handle than the 90 pounders I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I had to reinstall various screws with Lock Nut but otherwise the machine ran great. We did almost no maintenance for two years
customer_reviews.text: I am purchasing a replacement after my original knockoff Chinese manufactured jackhammer broke after two years of heavy use. We dig out basements and use the jackhammer for 5-6 hours (off and on) per digging session. I had to reinstall various screws with Lock Nut but otherwise the machine ran great. We did almost no maintenance for two years and it ran like a champ. It finally broke for good when the locking mechanism that holds the bits in place wore out and would no longer secure the bits. These jackhammers are so inexpensive that it's not worth it to try and repair. The Neiko appears to be the same model or design as my original jackhammer.
customer_reviews.author: GDel

customer_reviews.title: For the price it was awesome. David - The Redneck Garage YouTube Channel
customer_reviews.text: Bought it not really expecting that much and was surprised how well it broke up concrete where I had to add plumbing to an existing slab. The only negative which I saw on others comments is that it will leak oil down the main bit so you have to refill the oil or risk burning it up. For the price it was awesome. David - The Redneck Garage YouTube Channel.
customer_reviews.author: The Redneck Garage YT

customer_reviews.title: Good breaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hammer for the price I needed a cheap demo hammer and this delivers it uses alot of oil but I am super hard on it I use for landscaping for demoing concrete and this can take the abuse just like the name brand ones just have to monitor the oil levels but has been working great for me for almost two years of heavy abuse the bits are starting to wear down have not looked into buying another set have not tried the bits from my larger hammers yet will have to see what works looks to be similar bits
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Arrived once with a broken handle and once more with a cracked handle!
customer_reviews.text: I had no chance to use this jack hammer; I opened the box, opened its case, grasped its handle and tried to pull it out of its case. Boom! The handle was already broken at its base. There is no way to handle a jack hammer with a broken and-mind you-plastic handle. Imagine: A plastic handle used as a handle for a jack hammer! Naturally cannot withstand either the mishandling of transportation or the use for which is meant to. So I returned it and asked for a replacement. I received the replacement (same item) and yes the handle this time was cracked!!!! So, I returned it back and this time asked for my money back. Very frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: than pap

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how awesome this thing is for the money... I had to replace the tile in our main bathroom. After working my $@%& off for half a day and getting almost nowhere with a hammer, chisel and scraper, I decided to invest in this (because we plan to replace a lot more tile in the future). This thing cut through the tile like it was butter :D Nothing like the feel of this thing hammering away at the tile when you squeeze the trigger. I'm sure I'll have plenty of opportunities to use this in the future too.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Works great for digging holes
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through rocky soil. Seems like a good value for $150. I expect something to break for that price but it seems strong. In fact, very, very heavy. Tires me out. Use with Nieko 02627 spade shovel to dig holes. That spade I bought here fit this jack hammer perfectly. Make sure you don't just dig straight down and bury your spade. Aim in a loop so you can pull it out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike I

customer_reviews.title: Great for basement remodels
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plumber and usually rent a jack hammer to bust basement floors but it's a pain doing all that running around. I bought this without having high hopes but I will say after only using it once that this thing is awesome. It doesn't have quite the power of a larger jack hammer but it is also a lot lighter. It made short work of breaking out about 10 5 gallon buckets of cement. It does get a little warm but just kept chugging along. I don't know how long it will hold up but compared to renting one I will be money ahead after 1 more job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tool. Out of the box it has worked with no issue. I have used it for 3 or 4 hours breaking up an old sidewalk on my property and breaking free cement flashing on footings for a retaining wall. I have also used the optional spade tool to break up very hard soil.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Waters

customer_reviews.title: A Beast!
customer_reviews.text: Nervous to do 5 stars yet. Have had it exactly one day. First use it buried itself in very rocky ground in about three seconds. It smashed a piece of very hard rock into dust in about fifteen seconds. This thing is HUGE and it's very heavy. A good 45 pounds. Even the bits weigh a lot. The chisel weighs in at 3 pounds, and the point is only a half ounce lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: I hope this was just a bad unit, but I would not buy this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the overwhelming positive reviews for my home use. In the less than six months that I've had it, I've used it less than 10 times. I was very impressed after the first use. The hammer works. Unfortunately, after a month or two the hammer started leaking a lot of oil. I could have lived with that, but then around the 5 month mark, the motor started smoking and quit working altogether. The seller only warrantees it for one month and the manufacturer will not help either. Now I'm out $180. I hope this was just a bad unit, but I would not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Ludlum

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been working for several years now - gets heavy-duty use breaking up concrete and hardpan soil during the summer. I have excavated a 1200-square-foot area under my house - it was once a crawlspace with an average clearance of 2 feet - it is now a basement that has a new foundation and a ceiling height of 9 feet. I figured that compared to more-expensive tools from Bosch etc. that if this one broke, I'd just buy another. So far, it has shown no signs of slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan LAbbé

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona so the ground is extremely hard this item was a life saver or should I say back saver it works great and I was able to plant all my trees and plants a lot easier with this jack hammer. Also the customer service is awesome. I broke the handle and I couldn’t find the part anywhere so I contacted them and the rep his name is Eric went above and beyond to help me and found the part I needed. excellent five stars for them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: burnt out
customer_reviews.text: Got item but wasn't the same color as the silver one, it was an off green with same color case, seemed hard and solid like the review said. The job at hand was hammering out 5" concrete basement slap for french drains. the first time i used tool: the motor housing made a terrible burning smell and i gave the thing a break. the next time i used it, within a half hour, the tool starting sparking and smoking... at this point it seemed like a real shock hazard and i threw it in the 20 yard dumpster and rented out the bosch brute from the tool rental for 84$ cracked out the whole basement in 6hrs with that brute.
customer_reviews.author: Gilda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This thing packs quite a punch, for about 1/10th the price of the name brands. I can't speak to the longevity, but it gets the job done. Comes with 2 tips which are quite nice. As a homeowner just trying to break up a slab, this is perfect. The case came cracked, but who cares! I bought it for the tool, not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Manly!
customer_reviews.text: This was much cheaper than renting one. Now I try and find stuff to Jack hammer because why not? Its totally a Jack hammer which means yes its heavy as hell. It chewed right through the concrete floor in our bathroom in no time at all. Totally makes me feel like a MAN Make sure to read the directions and get some oil. IT DOES NOT COME PREFILLED WITH OIL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on digging
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is just perfect for getting concrete out of the way. Must remember that it only works on the ground. You cannot break up concrete walls, have to have the weight of the Jackhammer to work right. I have loaned mine out twice and got the same report back from those who used it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Leaks a little oil
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, sometimes it is difficult to get it into a position where it is actually hammering rather than just shaking the target. Maybe mine is broken? It also does leak a little bit if oil.
customer_reviews.author: Cliftonious

customer_reviews.title: This a a Professional Tool
customer_reviews.text: What a tool... Let me tell you this is some Jack Hammer... Even the case that it comes in is heavy duty plastic and this is This is a Heavy Weight Professional Tool... It tore through my concrete slab with little effort..
customer_reviews.author: RAA

customer_reviews.title: Power faded quickly
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad hammer, nice case, good price, but it didn't hold up well, seemed like the hammer faded quickly. Motor still runs and it still hammers, but it's kind of weak after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: HBE

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This hammer cut through my 5 in. concrete foundation like butter! I took less than 30 minutes to cut a 2X1 foot opening. I located the leak using a $30 mechanic's stethoscope. The hammer has already paid for itself because the local plumbing company charges $400 just to locate a leak under a concrete foundation, and over 1,500 dollars to bust thru and fix the leak. I can repair the leak now for just a few bucks for the fitting, and fill in the hole with concrete for very little money. The hammer is easy to use, but I recommend ear protection, and, of course, safety goggles. Very happy with this hammer's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Mabrito

customer_reviews.title: The Hammer Thats Worth It's Weight in Gold
customer_reviews.text: Using the Hammer for Prospecting works great saved myself a lot of picking and digging took out 5 yards of hard pack in no time. Great tool for the money already paid for it self with the amount of Gold I found. Works just as good as the Harbor Freight module and its $110 bucks less. If it last a Mining Season Great and at This Price I will be getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P West

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack Hammer
customer_reviews.text: First time using a Jack Hammer, Boughe this unit based on reviews. It is heavy, but does the job quickly. Makes breaking concrete a simple task.
customer_reviews.author: R.D.

customer_reviews.title: Item was received damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived damaged, both the case and the jackhammer itself. The handle was cracked into pieces, making it useless. I really needed the jackhammer for the next days of work, so I modified it to make a handle. It lasted and did the job, but definitely not ideal with an improvised handle. It worked, but eventually started to leak oil after about the 20th post hole I used it to dig. I'd like my money back, but I doubt that will happen since I modified it and already used it heavily
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Henninger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jackhammer
customer_reviews.text: I work in construction and constantly use this on small concrete demo work. For example deck piers and fence posts. It's been a year since I purchased it and have had no issues. I haven't even put the oil on it. Which reminds me I should go do that now...
customer_reviews.author: Jeune Roi

customer_reviews.title: Plastic handle broke within 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Bought to help dig post holes and within 5 minutes the plastic handle (trigger) broke completely off. Why would you have a plastic handle when the entire product is made of steel. Makes no sense. Went to local rental shop and rented a Hilti for $79 and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Graham

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, works well.
customer_reviews.text: Received fast. Instructions poor but tool is not terribly complicated to set up. Worked really well against 4" concrete in a foot wide trench and six foot long in basement. Took about 20 minutes. I was being careful due to pipes underneath and used water to keep dust down. Just position and let the weight of the tool do the job. This tool is very heavy. Buying this tool was smart given renting one for just a day was half the cost and I'll be using this multiple times
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool great price
customer_reviews.text: This hammer paid for itself a few times now, it’s not for a commercial use I think, but I’ve done three commercial jobs with it not very big but it took out some 7 inch thick concrete slab , and four or 5 inch slabs with no rebar it takes it out like nothing !!
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Ground rod driver
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and it works for light duty
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Very good value. I had an 8" thick cistern wall ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good value. I had an 8" thick cistern wall in my basement that needed to come down. My 7" Dewalt right angle grinder from both sides and my sledgehammer didn't intimidate it at all. The Nike started out chipping in from the edges and working it right down. The only problem I now face is removing 10 bushels of busted up concrete from my basement. Does anyone need some fill?
customer_reviews.author: garybair

customer_reviews.title: Great Jackhammer
customer_reviews.text: This jackhammer did the job quickly and efficiently. I knocked out a concrete curb approximately 30 feet in two hours.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Fetter

customer_reviews.title: Superior Vallue
customer_reviews.text: I had to come back after almost ten years to review this product!. We use this jackhammer on average at least twice a week from the moment we bought it (to dig through rocks and concrete to install fencing). After all this time, this jackhammer still performs as it did the first time we took it from the box. We have never changed the bit! This was worth every penny and even more!
customer_reviews.author: Alana Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Demo Jack Hammer
customer_reviews.text: This unit comes close in performance to the industrial units that rent for ~$50 with the added benefit of being lighter and easier to manage. If you have any concrete work to remove this is the tool that will take care of it. The optional spade attachement is benefitial for any digging that needs to be done in hard packed or clay type soil (good for shallow trenching also). The bits appear to be interchangeable with those that Bosch sells for there industrial jack hammers. I have used the hammer at least 6 times and feel it's paid for itself in the first 3 uses. Have to give this item a 5 star based on the cost and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Joey Joe Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Purchased with spade, on weight of reviews and need to avoid multiple $90/day rentals for occasional light (66 year-old DIY) usage for retaining wall foundations in adobe soil. Arrived 3 business days, well-packed, pristine, but w/o extra brushes. Looks HD, esp. tool-bits, except 16Ga cord seems light for cont.duty. Compensating with 12Ga ext.cord + locally high 122VAC (to reduce heat and brush-wear). Tested spade on dry, hard-packed rocky adobe: buried spade in 2-3sec. However, had to push lightly to keep tool-shaft engaged with piston. Hope this annoyance goes away with wear. Bull-nose on concrete: also impressive. Fun, but no toy. Feels heavier than its 38# (with spade).
customer_reviews.author: AFL166

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This unit arrived in days, and coming from the other coast, I consider that that to be excellent service. The unit is heavy duty.... and quite powerful. Update: Over the past 2 years this tool has been used to - bust up a concrete porch, 45 feet of sidewalk, and set of concrete steps. Still functioning perfectly. I am quite impressed with this demo hammer. The unit is large and quite heavy, which means all that needs done is to set it where you want it and hang on..... no pressure needed. For the do-it-yourselfer...... this is a great addition to the tool collection. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Photobug

customer_reviews.title: It does leak a little but I have had guys say they like it better than the big expensive ones for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple years and it keeps hitting hard. It does leak a little but I have had guys say they like it better than the big expensive ones for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: aventure101

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: So handy ! If I need to dig a hole this will make it easier it even will split wood !
customer_reviews.author: wwwPaulsWackyWorld

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic handle.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a decent tool.. handle work trigger assembly snapped off the very first time the tool was used. Worked for no more than 30 seconds. and that's a shame because it made a beautiful hole in the concrete in about 25 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: ... make and design - the first one still works beautifully (I used it to create a French drain that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second jack hammer of the same make and design - the first one still works beautifully (I used it to create a French drain that required cutting and breaking up 50 feet of 6 inch deep concrete).... however, my brother who is out in California needed one for a demo project he was working, so I bought him one. He completed the job and couldn't be happier. Unfortunately the price did creep up since I bought mine, but even the higher priced second one was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paladin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: I initially wanted to return this item until I used it and it is exactly what I needed it’s a great item I would recommend this product it’s perfect and at a great price, I’m hard over how this thing works.
customer_reviews.author: REDGHOST74

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, tough, rugged
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best thing about this is the price. I was borrowing my neighbor's Makita demo hammer for a while, but after a certain point I had to get one of my own. This won the price war by a mile and is good enough for the price that I highly recommend it. If it was a few hundred dollars more, I'd complain about the weight and the fact that it leaks oil if I leave it upside down, but for the price, you take what you get because it kicks the crap out of a hammer and chisel. (Am I damning it with faint praise?) It's good, functional, and cheap. Sometimes that's all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The Handle is plastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Jack Hammer to do some work around a tree and as I moved it forward the handle broke. To my surprise it was not metal or metal cover in plastic. But plastic!!! Buyer beware its great for light jobs!
customer_reviews.author: pale writer

customer_reviews.title: WORKHORSE AT A GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: MADE FAST WORK OF THE CONCRETE THAT NEEDED TO BE BROKE UP. WORKS GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this was good for the money and ran just fine on my ...
customer_reviews.text: this was good for the money and ran just fine on my mid-size generator; however for breaking through a big rock/boulder in the ground it didn't have enough weight/power to make it effective. took me several hours to make enough progress to install a metal pole for fence installation. haven't used it since. might come in handy one day but not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Tough Brutal Beast for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: This demolition hammer is a great bargain for the occasional user. Its solid and busts up concrete very well - just as well as the expensive Bosch rental unit I recently tried. I read the negative reviews of this unit and simply cannot understand their comments. This s a great demolition hammer for home use or light industrial use. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Logan

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Its heavy which is probably a good thing. I only had a small job to do, but it would have been a pain doing it with a sledge hammer,with the jack hammer I was done in less then ten minutes. I have one more thing to do with it and then I should be done for a while. Not real expensive and it works . Don't forget to add oil....
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at removing a few concrete steps and small slab
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great so far. I used it to remove a few concrete steps and a small concrete slab. I paid $169.49 and feel as though I have already got my monies worth. Prior to using this it was taking me MANY hours with a hammer/chisel. This was able to turn those many hours into a few easy minutes. I kept it well oiled and did not push it hard (gave it frequent breaks just in case). I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I live in south west Austin Texas where the top soil is about 3 inches deep then it's a solid sheet of limestone. I needed to plant a few trees and a shovel just would not cut it. I also tried a pick axe but after about 10 swings I gave up and started searching for a jackhammer. They rent jack hammers at big name home & garden stores for about $70 a day. This jackhammer paid for itself in two days. It took me about 30 minutes per hole but it got the job done and I'm very happy with the purchase. This jackhammer is my shovel!
customer_reviews.author: atxmoses

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It cost less to purchase than a days rental would have been. Great quality and a good workout. Does not come with oil. It calls for Rotella 40w don't use it until you add the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neiko jack hammer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jackhammer almost a year ago...and I've only recently got round to using it! I have to say I'm very impressed how easily it broke through a 6 inch thick concrete slab! Initially I was a bit dubious when I started chipping away at the sidewalk....but after I broke through and created a hole, the jackhammer did what it's supposed to do with relative ease. Overall, I'm pleased with my investment.
customer_reviews.author: AlanB'stard

customer_reviews.title: Break everything in it's path
customer_reviews.text: This jackhammer can take down anything. It's very heavy and bruised my knees because I leaned against it trying to shove it down the cement to break it apart. Will require you to be strong. The machine basically does all the work but you still halfto be able to lift it about 30-40 pounds plus pushing it down to get it started which takes about 10 more pounds of force so you're looking at about 50-60 pounds of muscle to destroy the cement. The machine is a monster and does it's job extremely well. Super heavy duty. This can destroy anything. Excellent !
customer_reviews.author: Josef C. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy hitter demolition hammer that'll always surprise you, not being a common brand name tool but I'll tell you, it will get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Kas

customer_reviews.title: Whats the fuss...
customer_reviews.text: I mustve been lucky. No oil, no mess like most of the reviewers . Case arrived in tack an undamaged as well. Overall i like this jack hammer. Once you learn the tricks to operation it works well. One handy feature i like is that you can set it to stay on, rather than just short bursts or holding the on button. Found that out by accident. Cool. overall satisfied. Has already paid for itself during a soil stack excavation.
customer_reviews.author: papa

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: While I personally don't use this item, my husband loves it. He was a bit worried it would be too light and not really a quality product due to the price but overall he's very pleased. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: great jack hammer
customer_reviews.text: used this to demo a large area of concrete , this hammer will tear through some concrete once you get started. great deal since renting one for a day is almost the same price as buying this unit. I have had this for about 5 years now , I dont use it often but it does still work
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Worst tool I have purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. Thin case broken on arrival. Oil container broke, spilling throughout contents. During first 5 hours: excessive oil leaks on main shaft; electrical burning smell; half the time, motor spins without engaging hammer action; sporadically, trigger gets NO response from motor. Front handle slips, limiting control. More junk from China.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Skuper
customer_reviews.text: This is a super machine for the price and just the right size of little old me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: I found this Jack Hammer to be an excellent machine. I wanted a jack hammer to break up the hard concrete type soil I have in my yard. This tool was perfect for my needs. It is light enough for me to lift with one hand but heavier enough for it to break the rock like gravel without any additional pushing action. It also came with a strong plastic case with wheels so it was easy to move and store. A good tool at a good price. I was very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peter McHugh

customer_reviews.title: This works great. The only downside is the height
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The only downside is the height, if you're tall you will be bent over to use it. No issues with oil like some others described. It cuts through rock and cement easy and made installing our chain link much faster.
customer_reviews.author: kelly maisenbach

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and useful.
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rock mountain so any digging results in hitting tough rock. This little fella manages to chip its way through most of the stuff and allow me to sink post holes and other foundations. Reasonably priced and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Bought this tool to take out concreted in fence post ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tool to take out concreted in fence post, worked perfectly, would have cost 100.00 a day to rent the same tool, took five days to get my post out.. saved a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: danny r simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Im a 61 year old woman and was able to break up my driveway to install a block retaining wall! Would have taken forever without it!! works great leaks a little oil but still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: My "Go To" tool
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for over six years. It is rugged, powerful, and durable.It really does the job. Concrete and rock pulverize before it. The only thing I'm not in love with is its weight. Floors are easy, but holding it up above the waist to demolish rock walls, etc. is very demanding.
customer_reviews.author: W. B. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good for large jobs
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase it because it's not one of the heavy jackhammers but it did a good job. I had a 4" slab about 20'x3' and a 6" concrete stoop about 4'x6' with concrete steps. Also 4 legs of an oil tank that was asphalted in the ground. With all the work I had I figured I would need a heavy (100 to 120 pounds) double handle unit but this did better than expected and probably worked better than the heavy units around the tank legs where I needed to move around easily. Since it's much smaller it's easier to store too.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Oil seal leak / not durable enough.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a total of about 4 to 5 hours over several days. Began to leak oil excessively. Hammering action does not always engage requiring a lift and drop action for breaking level strokes to engage or re-triggering the power trigger. Unit is all metal and heavy. Does break up hard cement and bricks. Should have held up better.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered for clay dirt.
customer_reviews.text: No more back breaking labor for trying to dig a hole in clay soil. Got the hammer and the spade shovel that go's with it. Just smiled while I watched it cut through the clay like I was slicing ham. The hammers a little heavy but so what, thats what makes it cut. Im 508 and 170 lbs, no body builder. I was able to handle digging a mailbox post and 3 holes for large bushes.....
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: For the price very good item
customer_reviews.text: Got item around 10am this morning was ready to use it unboxed learned no oil shipped so I had to run to home Depot for oil. Anyways now 5pm and I completed a 20 by 15 patio jackhammer no issues with it performed very well it would have been five stars if it came with oil.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Made a very short work of a 10 by 14 slab
customer_reviews.author: Kyle King

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for breaking up concrete to repair sewer line.
customer_reviews.author: blackey

customer_reviews.title: Stands abuse
customer_reviews.text: I got alot of use out of it. I abused and didnt maintain it and it finally died. If maintained it will last 10 years or more.
customer_reviews.author: Swampboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Very strong equipment for cement breaking. Excellent product for affordable price. I am very pleased with the too. Thank you for prompt shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value jackhammer, went through 12", but funky trigger
customer_reviews.text: The jackhammer busted through a 20 sq foot, 12 inch thick slab. The value is amazing as I saved $50 buying opposed to renting for two days. Didn't come with any oil, and needed to play with the trigger constantly so that the hammer portion would engage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: it can not sustitute a quality more expensive tool
customer_reviews.text: tool didn't last enough ,it can do any though job, but after a total of 40 hours of use broke !
customer_reviews.author: william herrera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Easy to use and easy to change bits. Went through cement floor and concrete blocks with no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... used it yet but is very heavy and looks like it will last for a few years
customer_reviews.text: i have not used it yet but is very heavy and looks like it will last for a few years. came with extra brushes for the engine.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful, given the lower price than the competition, but this thing actually works pretty well. Occasionally doesn't engage the hammer action without a nudge, but once it does has lots of power. Has a sign on the case which includes the words "with Huge bits" which my visiting British friends found amusing (slang)
customer_reviews.author: ScottS

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat it
customer_reviews.text: Nothing feels more manly then smashing stuff for a purpose. I've had no issues so far and I used it to install both a sump pump and radon well having had any oil leaks what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Worked great putting in a basement shower drain
customer_reviews.text: Worked great putting in a basement shower drain. It wouldn't have been much cheaper to rent on and I own it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but rework quality weaknesses
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in 2011 after considering that the jackhammer cost ($140) was less than the 1-day rental of a pneumatic jackhammer and supporting compressor. I also read the previous reviews written by customers that had anticipated the design and quality shortcomings and provided remedial instructions to turn a cheap piece of crap into a reliable workhorse. Reviewing and following the wise instructions of the previous users was extremely useful and the reworked jackhammer has worked like a champ for 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondtail

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to tear out an eight foot high retaining wall and concrete steps, it got the job done after my dads industrial jack hammer died. If I had to get another one, I wouldn't think twice on ordering this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Draxix Entreri

customer_reviews.title: Needs better packaging
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery for what seems a very sturdy built jack hammer however, as others have said, I too had a dented up case which is too thin walled to support this heavy item. I am sure It will be dented more from use so this is not an issue however, the oil that's supplied was broken open by the bits and this oil was everywhere. The tools supplied had bounced around and scratched the hammer. The bits and the oil needs to be shipped separately.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Buddy

customer_reviews.title: for part-time, amateur work, it is great.
customer_reviews.text: Note: This is NOT a commercial, industrial machine. But for home use, it worked great for me to break thru concrete for a sump pump, and to break up concrete. It would have cost me $100 @ day to rent a jack hammer. Or I could buy this for $150. So, after using it 2 days, you are ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight J. Worker

customer_reviews.title: But over all it works - just not the greatest.
customer_reviews.text: Have to hold at a certain angle to get it to chip properly. If there is already broken hanging pieces - wont chip them very well. But over all it works - just not the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Gallo Plumbing

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Some shock absorption on the handle would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Repeat Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this item. Already used it a couple of times! Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: EMT

customer_reviews.title: I have a problem with this machine, I went to use it again and it does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with this machine, I went to use it again and it does not work, I just used 4 times what can I do to solve this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Much better than renting as you can spread out the work
customer_reviews.text: Tore up over 8 inches of concrete with re-bar. Much better than renting as you can spread out the work. Make sure to put the oil in it. As others have noted oil does spill a bit in the case. For the money this cannot be beat and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Some staying power
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this and two years later is still using it. For the price, it has held up very well and been a great tool to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: akamindyk

customer_reviews.title: It is extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Avoid at all costs. Cheap Chinese crap. I bought it to break through rocks for fence post holes and the handle broke completely off the machine on the third one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I rated it very high due to it's price for the job it accomplished. I had a project (major bathroom remodel) where I had to break up a concrete floor in sections. I needed to be able to space the work out over a 4-5 day period. The cost to rent a jackhammer would have been twice the amount I paid for the tool. I have had previous experience in using a jackhammer, and was very impressed with the performance of this item. It did the job, and I now have a new tool in my bag of tricks. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: firemsdive

customer_reviews.title: It works and it works very well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jackhammer with a great deal of reservation but I have now used it for a couple of years, lent it to friends and come to the realization that it has paid for itself over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: John Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Insanely cheap price
customer_reviews.text: This is basically the exact same body for the Harbor Freights demo hammer, just a different color body. The Harbor Freights one is 5 times the price. Neither are of the quality of dewalt, but they both work fine....this is just cheaper
customer_reviews.author: J. Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a dud but I am surprised at how weak this thing is. It has taken me a long while to break up a concrete slab to get at a sewer pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Twotonwonton

customer_reviews.title: Easily cut through hard clay soil
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the TR89102 Clay Spade Scoop Shovel and this combo worked perfectly. Had to dig a fairly big hole to fix my irrigation system. Easily cut through hard clay soil. Best part, can't beat the price I paid (yay for Amazon Prime!).
customer_reviews.author: Barry K. Muranaka

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together & use. Did not come full of oil or with any extra.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Economical Jack Hammer
customer_reviews.text: The Jack Hammer arrived quickly and in good condition. All parts were included plus a good carrying case. I've used it several times already for digging in hard soil and breaking up concrete, which worked well. Based on the cost of renting and what I've seen as the cost of other Jack Hammers, this is an excellent value. I can't speak for extended use in heavy conditions, but I would recommend this to anyone who occassionally needs to rent a Jack Hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Good tool no service
customer_reviews.text: Hammer works great. Instruction book is poorly written and you cant get repair parts for the unit and my handle cracked after the first attempt to use.
customer_reviews.author: S R.

customer_reviews.title: Still using it after two years
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to break concrete around the pool, it works fine, I didn't have any issue. Well only keep you eyes on oil level, bolt may come loose so a little tune up is required. It works fine for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

product_meta.title: Neiko 02845A Electric Demolition Jack Hammer with Point and Flat Chisel Bits
product_meta.description: Industrial-Grade Electric Demolition Jack Hammer, with 2 Huge Bits. Super heavy-duty electric jack-hammer for serious demolition jobs.
feature_bullets: Powerful 11.3 Amp high performance motor delivers 1,800 impact beats per minute with 45 joules force to easily break through concrete, brick, ground and earth
Heavy duty all metal construction with industrial sand blasted powder coating finish for corrosion resistance and durability
Specially engineered helical gear system operates more smoothly and quietly than traditional spur gear, and more importantly, lasts longer and reduces premature wear out
360 Degree swivel auxiliary handle with non-slip grip provides maximum control and support for user operation
Comes with a blow molded case with rolling wheels for easy and convenient transportation
Equipped with 2 pieces drop forged and heat treated alloy steel chisels: 1-pc 16” point chisel and 1-pc 1-1/4” x 16” flat chisel
Set comes complete with accessories: 4 extra carbon brushes, 1 oil container, 3 wrenches, 1 safety protection kit with goggles and work gloves

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars419 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
